Class DbManager

extends java.lang.Object

      • getConnection

        private java.sql.Connection getConnection(java.lang.String dbName)
        This method returns connection to the dbName db;
        Parameters:
        dbName - db to connect to
        Returns:
        Returns a connection to the dbName db;

      • authenticate

        public int authenticate(java.lang.String hashedUsername,
                        java.lang.String hashedPassword)
        connects to the 'slingshot' database and checks the hashed username and password against the records in the credentials table.
        Parameters:
        hashedUsername -
        hashedPassword -
        Returns:
        returns -2 if there was a database error, 1 if the authentication is successful and -1 otherwise.

      • addManager

        public boolean addManager(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> info)
        This method adds an admin manager to the credentials table.
        Parameters:
        info - manager information including a map of (credentialsID, firstName, lastName, username, password, email) key/values.
        Returns:
        returns true if manager was added successfully.

      • search

        public java.util.List<Customer> search(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters)
        This method searches customer(s) based on the fields in the search form in manageCustomer.jsp page.
        Parameters:
        parameters - a map includes key/values of search parameters.
        Returns:
        returns the customers matched to the criteria (parameters) The parameters argument includes the following customer info: ID, first name, middle name, last name, address, city, province, country, postal code, cell, home, work, email and alternative email.

      • search2

        public java.util.List<Customer> search2(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters)
        This method searches customer(s) based on the fields in the search form in manageCustomer.jsp page.
        Parameters:
        parameters - a map includes key/values of search parameters.
        Returns:
        returns the customers matched to the criteria (parameters) The parameters argument includes the following customer info: ID, first name, middle name, last name, address, city, province, country, postal code, cell, home, work, email and alternative email.

      • updateCustomer

        public int updateCustomer(java.lang.String[] customerInfo)
        This method updates a customer.
        Parameters:
        customerInfo - customer info in an array.The argument includes the following customer info: ID, first name, middle name, last name, address, city, province, country, postal code, cell, home, work, email and alternative email.
        Returns:
        returns 1 if update was successful and 0 otherwise.

      • addCustomer

        public int addCustomer(java.lang.String[] customerInfo)
        This method adds a customer to the existing customers. customerID must be unique.
        Parameters:
        customerInfo - customer info in an array.The argument includes the following customer info: ID, first name, middle name, last name, address, city, province, country, postal code, cell, home, work, email and alternative email.
        Returns:
        returns 1 if addition was successful and 0 otherwise.

      • deleteCustomer

        public int deleteCustomer(java.lang.String[] customerInfo)
        This method removes a customer from the list of existing customers.
        Parameters:
        customerInfo - customer info in an array.The argument includes the following customer info: ID, first name, middle name, last name, address, city, province, country, postal code, cell, home, work, email and alternative email.
        Returns:
        returns 1 if deletion was successful and 0 otherwise.

      • checkNULL

        public java.lang.String checkNULL(java.lang.String field)
        This is a method that processes a potentially null table field.
        Parameters:
        field -
        Returns:
        if the argument is null it returns 'NULL' otherwise it returns the argument itself.
